long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Copy any network request as a cURL command line.

As we all know, the DevTools of Chrome browser include a Network panel.
In the network panel, users can right-click on each network request and select the copy as cURL menu to copy the network request as a curl command.
This feature works fine when users use MacOS or Linux.

Unfortunately, when users use Windows, this feature doesn't work properly, because Windows doesn't support command parameters surrounded by single quotes.

Using this extension can solve this problem.

How to use it ?
Step 1. User can open chrome DevTools, and select 'cURL' panel.
Step 2. User browser web page, then the 'cURL' panel will list every request made by the browser.
Step 3. In the cURL panel, click the copy button in front of any request.
The perfect curl command line will be copied to the system clipboard :-)
